_description: True learning now disregarded — two six-line stanzas

PierpontAcc676.First Lines:
Ipocras great wysedoum haddas storyes doth
                    declare…
PierpontAcc676.Last Lines:
…but this vesure which is most truethat hell for sine a place
                    is dewe
PierpontAcc676.Note: Added to lower margin by a hand of the sixteenth century.
PierpontAcc676.Editions:
Bühler,  Curt F.,
                        ed.  
             The Dicts and Sayings of the Philosophers.
EETS
         o.s. 211 (1941); repr. 1991: 333.
